definition: to travel to take up a new post
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task

sentences.english: The theme of poetry about seeing off someone going to his post dominates a great proportion of all poems in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 送人赴任之作，在唐代別離詩中佔有相當大比例。

sentences.english: As a Colonel, he was transferred to the high profile Death Star assignment.
sentences.chinese: 作爲上校，他被調動到高層的死星赴任。

sentences.english: A student say goodbye to his master before he leave Beijing for taking a post in another place.
sentences.chinese: 一個學生在離京到外地赴任之前，去向他的老師告別。

sentences.english: He is expected to assume his duties at FAO in January 2008.
sentences.chinese: 預計他將於2008年1月到糧農組織赴任。

sentences.english: I had an interview with the ambassador designate.
sentences.chinese: 我採訪了即將赴任的大使。

sentences.english: Say that this is going to a cocktail invented by the British South Seas to his new post.
sentences.chinese: 具說這種雞尾酒是前往南洋赴任的英國人發明的。

sentences.english: Fung was the General Manager ofthe Courtyard by Marriott Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 此次來上海赴任前，馮先生是香港萬怡酒店的總經理。

definition: to transfer/to move to another post
to hold an office or post
to return to the capital
to leave office
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to be promoted to
one's office/place where one holds a post
to ask sb to resign from a post
to take office/to assume a post
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
to enter the capital/to go to Beijing
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to hand over to a successor/to relinquish one's office
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to leave office/to leave one's post
local magistrate
